title: Which kings never fought a battle in their rule? - Quora

response.answer_text: Any number. Many kings were too old or too young to fight during their reigns, and since the 18th century they’ve basically been glorified civil servants rather than warriors, anyway. Al;so, some of them, believe it or not, reigned in peace time. Answering for Great Britain, the last king to fight a battle was George II (r. 1727–1760) at the Battle of Dettingen. No subsequent king has fought in wartime.
No British king , as a king has been in battle since George 2 at Dettingham George 6 was at Jutland he was the spare at that point, his daddy George V was king
